result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J Albert

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive unless properly licensed. Must install IID device in any vehicle driven. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

8:52 AM Defendant Richard J Albert in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn in court for Richard J Albert.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Matter is scheduled on Defense's Motion to modify bond.
Defense is requesting bond be modified to a $750 signature bond.
Parties are waiting on blood results.
Deft has other matters pending in two other counties.
State has some concerns given the deft's prior record.
BTC: Modify bond to a $1000 signature bond, all conditions remain, matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from Defendant requesting new court date

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Deft is eligible for SPD services
State's Notice and summary of expert testimony of Law Enforcement Officer and/or analyst
State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence
State's Notice of Intent to introduce 911 recordings
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Expert testimony
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Must install IID device in any vehicle driven. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard J Albert appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Richard J Albert. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
